SIAMCAT
  • Reference

Check and visualize associations between features and classes

This function calculates for each feature the median log10 fold change between the different classes found in labels.

Significance of the differences is computed for each feature using a wilcoxon test followed by multiple hypothesis testing correction.

Additionally, the Area under the Receiver Operating Characteristic Curve (AU-ROC) is computed for the features found to be associated with the two different classes at a user-specified significance level alpha.

Finally, the function produces a plot of the top max.show associated features, showing the distribution of the log10-transformed abundances for both classes, the median fold change, and the AU-ROC.

check.associations(feat, label, fn.plot, color.scheme = "RdYlBu",
  alpha = 0.05, min.fc = 0, mult.corr = "fdr", detect.lim = 10^-8,
  max.show = 50, plot.type = "bean")

Arguments

feat

feature object
label

label object
fn.plot

filename for the pdf-plot
color.scheme

valid R color scheme, defaults to 'RdYlBu'
alpha

float, significance level, defaults to 0.05
min.fc

float, minimum log10 fold change for significantly associated features, defaults to 0
mult.corr

multiple hypothesis correction method, see p.adjust, defaults to "fdr"
detect.lim

float, pseudocount to be added before log-transormation of the data, defaults to 1e-08
max.show

integer, how many associated features should be shown, defaults to 50
plot.type

string, specify how the abundance should be plotted, must be one of these: c("bean", "box", "quantile.box", "quantile.rect"), defaults to "bean"

Value

Does not return anything, but produces an association plot

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
